intro: Astartea reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined starwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Astartea reticulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
